summary: New BRUTAL armor models for Iron, Steel, Orcish, Elven, Hide, Steel Plate, Daedric & more to come!
descriptionHtml:
-=If you liked this mod, please hit the endorse button!=-

Also available through [url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=10802]Steam Workshop[/url]

================
Latest Update 2.4:
================

* Added Daedric Brutal Armor.

* Added fix for female steel boots clipping issue.

* Now in BSA archive form.

* Fixed inventory display for Steel Brutal Armor.

* Crafting now requires materials similar to those used to make the original armor; specifically 1 less metal Ingot and several more pieces of leather & leather strips.

* This latest update is NOT backwards compatible with earlier versions; If you use this version, you will lose any Brutal Armor created using a previous version. You can use console commands to give yourself back any lost armor first by typing: \'help brutal\' to get the item ID for the armor you want to receive, then by typing: \'player.additem X 1\' where X was the item ID number for the relevant armor. 

===========
Introduction:
===========

Do you want to look like a total bad-ass while playing Skyrim, but cant pull it off decked head-to-toe in gear that screams \"please dont hurt me\" ? Why not swap that needlessly covering armor for one that offers enhanced airflow and 110% more barbarian charisma with BRUTAL ARMOR v2!!!

===========
What it does:
===========

Adds new armor models to several categories in the smithing forge. All new armors follow the naming convention of \'X Brutal Armor\', where X is the type of armor it is based off, such as Iron, Steel, Elven, etc. To forge Brutal Armor you simply require the appropriate Smithing perk, and materials similar to those required to make the original armor; specifically 1 less metal Ingot and several more pieces of leather & leather strips.

These new armors can be combined with the other armor pieces in the same category for the purpose of the Matching Set perk, and they can all be improved at the Armor Smithing Bench.

==========
Installation:
==========

Extract the zip file into your Skyrim\\Data directory, or DL with the Mod Manager.

============
Uninstallation:
============

Remove the Skyrim\\Data\\Meshes\\Armor\\Brutal\\ & Skyrim\\Data\\Textures\\Armor\\Brutal\\ folders, and delete Skyrim\\Data\\Brutal Armor.esp

============
Enhancement:
============

To get the most out of this mod, you may want to consider using:

* [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=44]Female Muscle Mod[/url] for that totally bad-ass barbarian chick look!

* [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=3261]Hvergelmir\'s Armor Retexure[/url] & [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=7045]Hvergelmir\'s Shield Retexture[/url] to look your best! make sure to DL my optional HD texture file for full compatibility.

* [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=6463]Iron and Ancient Nord helm replacer[/url] because curly-horns for women is discrimination!

* [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=7696]Armored Circlets[/url] if you\'d rather wear a circlet than a helm, and not have to give up the armor & armor set perks!

* [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=1561]Matching Orcish Shield[/url] if you use an orcish shield with orcish armor, this helps make them a better visual match.

* [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=5803]Crown Helmets[/url] for less bulky helmets, perfect for preventing helmet-hair!

* [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=4866]Open Faced Helmets[/url] so you dont have to hide away your (or your follower\'s) face if you still prefer helms over circlets.

=======
Credits:
=======

[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=3261]Hvergelmir[/url]: HD iron armor texture.

[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=6684]rahman530[/url]: female brassiere texture.

===========
Coming Soon:
===========

[s]* Iron[/s]
[s]* Steel[/s]
[s]* Elven[/s]
[s]* Orcish[/s]
[s]* Hide[/s]
[s]* Steel Plate[/s]
[s]* Daedric[/s]
* Tsun
* Blades
* Falmer
* Ebony
* Glass
* Dragonplate
* Dragonscale
* Stormcloak
* Imperial Heavy
* Imperial Light
* Leather
* Thieves Guild
* Dwarven
* Ancient Nord
* Mage robes

What I wont be doing:

* CBBE or UNP - too difficult to adapt.
* studded or scaled derivations: wont be different enough to be worth the effort.
* dark brotherhood, nightingales: not enough potential to be adapted to a more rugged look.
* recolour requests. I can give permission + advice to people wishing to do the work themselves, but have little interest in doing it for myself.

===========
Old Updates:
===========

Update 2.1:

* Added Elven & Orcish armor variants.

* Uploaded new, better HD texture adaptation, custom made by Hvergelmir.


Update 2.2:

* Added Hide armor variant.

* File names restructured; players updating from a previous version may wish to delete the old directories before installing this one, as not all obsolete files will be overwritten.


Update 2.3:

* Added Steel Plate armor variant.

* Rebalanced stats and crafting materials for flavour: each type of armor requires one vanilla armor of the same type + one steel ingot, two leather and four leather strips to craft, and the resulting armor is significantly lighter than the vanilla version and still gives the same amount of protection.

* Uploaded each armor set as a stand-alone mod, as well as an all-in-one mod.
author: QuickFox
